709305f-a.text:
North on Sixth Avenue from N.E. corner of 3rd Street. Building with clock in left background is Jefferson Market Court,
on site of old Jefferson Aarket.
P.L.Sperr,Photographer.  March 11, 1932.
Mooking North on Sixth Avenue from 3rd Street.
February 20, 1932.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

709298f-b.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - 3rd Street (West).
709298f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, from W. 3rd (right) to W. 4th Streets (left),showing this frontage cleared of former buildings. This was necessitated by subway
construction.
The Pepper Pot, a Greenwich Village restaurant is at No. 148 W. 4th Street. View 2 is limited to this feature. This is photographed to outline same against buildings on the opposite side of the street. Note the Washington . E. Church there.
View 1: February 24, 1933
View 2: March 25, 1933
P. L. Sperr

709291f-b.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - 3rd Street (West).
709291f-b.text:
ixth Ave., west side, at the head of West 3rd Street, showing the r Lambs Ecclesiastical Art Works being converted into a motion re theatre. The two frame dwellings, Nos. 14 and 16 Cornelia Street,
are at the rear of this view will be included.
July 10, 1937.
Sperr.
ieatre completed.
December 10, 1937.
Sperr.
ghily more inclusive view of the same location photographed iE the Sixth Avenue 'E1' demolition. Note the iron pillars
formerly supported same in the foreground.

709290f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - 3rd Street (West).
709290f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, south from W. 3rd Street as viewed frem the "E;" at that point, showing a play area betwee5 same and Hleecker Street. Intersection seen ir the imrediate foreground is Minetta Lane. Minetta Place, of a quaint Greenwich Village, was formerly in the middle of the block to the south and was eradicated by the extersion of Sixth
Avenue.
May 31, 1938.
P.L. Sperr

709292f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - 3rd Street (West).
709292f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, from West 3rd to 4th Streets, showing subway construction. View No. 2 is the
same site at a later date.
In 1939, a playground will be constructed
by the W.N. A. here. The photographer's vantage point is under the "El" curve (demolished 1939) at 3rd Street and he is viewing northeastward towards Washington Square. The "'epper Pot" is on the south side of 4th Street where
it bears No. 148.
View 1: September 1, 1928
View 2: March 11, 1932
P. L. Sperr

709296f-b.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - 3rd Street (West).
709296f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, west side, at the head of West 3rd Street, showing the frontage extending between Carmine (left) and Cornelia (right) Street's. In the foreground is the cleared swath beneath which is the Sixth Avenue
Subway (under construction).
The J. Lamb Eccelesiastical Art Works is at No. 323-5.and in May, 1937 will be converted into a motion picture house, the Waverly Theatre. Views 2 and 3 are linited to this feature and show its relationship to the Sixth Avenue "El" curve at
3rd Street.
Views 1, 2: March 15, 1932
View 3: October 11, 1928
P. L. Sperr
